title: The Futility of Simulating Nature
content: In “The Anthropocene Illusion,” the photographer Zed Nelson captures how the natural world has been reproduced, reshuffled, and repackaged, sold to visitors in the form of spectacle.
alt: The Futility of Simulating Nature
author: Elizabeth Kolbert

title: Adam Friedland’s Comedy of Discomforts
content: His rendition of the talk show is innately subversive, at direct odds with the squeaky-clean, white-bread humor that is typical of its cable counterpart.
alt: Adam Friedland with two vintagelooking swivel chairs with a white desk
author: Brady Brickner-Wood

title: What Killed the Two-State Solution?
content: How deceit, delusion, and the inexorable pull of the past have transformed an idea once seen as a possible means to end the Israeli-Palestinian conflict into a dangerous gimmick.
alt: Illustration of a solider firing a grenade launcher into a endless reflection
author: Hussein Agha

title: Missing Sheep
content: We all play a bit of a game when in love, don’t we?
alt: Illustration of woman falling into a pool
author: Anne Carson

title: Bill Belichick Goes Back to School
content: Can the legendary former Patriots coach transform U.N.C. football?
alt: An illustration of Bill Belichick and Jordon Hudson on a football field
author: Paige Williams

title: Pam Bondi’s Power Play
content: Donald Trump now has the Attorney General he always wanted—an ally willing to harness the law to enable his agenda.
alt: Portrait of Pam Bondi holding a golden outline of Trump.
author: Ruth Marcus

title: The Lives and Loves of James Baldwin
content: An older generation dismissed him as passé; a newer one has recast him as a secular saint. But Baldwin’s true message remains more unsettling than either camp recognizes.
alt: Two men lying in a bed.
author: Louis Menand

title: How I Learned to Become an Intimacy Coördinator
content: At a sex-choreography workshop, a writer discovered a world of Instant Chemistry exercises, penis pouches, and nudity riders to train for Hollywood’s most controversial job.
alt: Person between the lips of two silhouettes.
author: Jennifer Wilson

title: A Doctor Without Borders
content: Lina Qasem Hassan treated victims of the October 7th attacks. But when she decried the deaths of Palestinian civilians in Gaza—and the targeting of hospitals there—some of her patients demanded her firing.
alt: Lina Qasem Hassan sitting grass Neighborhood and City
author: Jennifer Wilson

title: Jarvis Cocker Is Out of the Rain
content: The Pulp singer on conquering his fear of nature, the pleasures and perils of art and aging, and the band’s first new album in twenty-four years.
alt: The Pulp singer Jarvis Cocker
author: Sarah Larson

title: Amelia Earhart’s Reckless Final Flights
content: The aviator’s publicity-mad husband, George Palmer Putnam, kept pushing her to risk her life for the sake of fame. Before her final last takeoff, the warning signs were everywhere.
alt: Amelia Earhart’s.
author: Laurie Gwen Shapiro

title: Twenty celebrity-owned companies on Shopify
content: From Taylor Swift’s merchandise store to the Beckham's fashion and eyewear brands, we showcase 20 celebrity-owned companies on Shopify.
alt: Picture of celebrity companies on Shopify
author: Sarah Larson

title: Thirteen bridal wear brands on Shopify
content: From made-to-order luxury bridal gowns to more affordable ready-to-wear bridesmaid dresses, we take a look at the bridal stores using Shopify to sell their pieces.
